info.title: Zaprite API
info.description: The Zaprite API lets you get and create Orders programmatically to easily integrate the Zaprite Checkout experience into your own website. You can also configure Webhooks to get notified about events on your Zaprite Organization. If you have questions or need help integrating with the Zaprite API, please [contact us](https://help.zaprite.com/).

post.description:
Create a Zaprite Order and send your customer to `checkoutUrl` to pay.
ðŸ’¡ To test your integration, you can use Zaprite Test Payment connection to complete an Order with no real payment.

amount.description: Amount denominated in currency smallest unit (e.g., cents for USD, satoshis for BTC). Example: `100` for $1.00 USD.

externalUniqId.description: Optionally, you can store your own unique ID for this order. This can be useful for reconciling payments with your own systems.

redirectUrl.description: Redirect your customer to this URL after they have paid for the order.

redirectIfPending.description: If true, the customer will be redirected to `redirectUrl` even if the order is still pending (ie. Bitcoin transaction is unconfirmed).

label.description: Will be shown on the checkout page and in Bitcoin on-chain transaction labels.

customCheckoutId.description: If you want a custom checkout for specific orders, you can configure a new checkout at https://app.zaprite.com/org/default/checkouts/new

orgId.description: Id of the Zaprite organization that created this order

totalAmount.description: Total amount to be paid by the customer in currency smallest unit (e.g. cents or sats)

status.description: `PENDING`: The order is pending payment</br>`PROCESSING`: The order received a payment but the transaction is still pending (ie. an on-chain transaction with 0 conf or manual bank transfer awaiting manual confirmation)</br>`PAID`: The order was paid but it requires manual fulfillment to be flagged as `COMPLETE`</br>`COMPLETE`: The order was paid and is complete</br>`OVERPAID`: The order received a payment that was more than the total amount</br>`UNDERPAID`: The order received a payment that was less than the total amount

paidAt.description: Date in ISO 8601 format (e.g. "2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z"). `null` until the order is paid.

checkoutUrl.description: Send your customer to this URL to complete the payment

contact.description: Optional Zaprite contact associated with this order

number.description: Invoice number, displayed on the invoice page and PDF

daysToPay.description: Natural days from invoice date before the invoice is overdue. If null, invoice will be shown as "DUE ON RECEIPT"

date.description: Date of the invoice, displayed on the invoice page and PDF. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

hideOrgAddress.description: Organization address is hidden on the public invoice

hideOrgEmail.description: Organization email is hidden on the public invoice

hideOrgName.description: Organization name is hidden on the public invoice

sentAt.description: Date when the invoice was sent to the customer

unitPrice.description: Price of the item in currency smallest unit (e.g. cents or sats)

taxAmount.description: In currency smallest unit (e.g. cents or sats)

invoice.description: Set only if the order is for a Zaprite invoice (`orderType="invoice"`), `null` otherwise

paymentLink.description: Set only if the order was created from a Payment Link (`orderType="paymentLink"`), `null` otherwise

amount.description: Transaction amount in currency smallest unit (e.g. cents or sats)

amountInOrderCurrency.description: Transaction amount denominated in the currency of the Order and in smallest unit (e.g. cents or sats)

amountOff.description: Amount of the discount denominated in `orderCurrency` and in smallest unit (e.g cents or sats). Negative value means a premium was applied.

rateBipsOff.description: Rate of the discount in bips (e.g. 1234 for 12.34%). Negative value means a premium was applied.

paymentType.description: Type of payments this discount applies to

discountsInOrderCurrency.description: List premiums and discounts applied to this transaction. Note: The amount retained as payment for the Order is `amountInOrderCurrency + sum(discountsInChargeCurrency.amount)`

orderCurrency.description: Currency of the Order this transaction is paying for. For example, when paying an USD invoice in BTC, transaction `currency` would be USD and `orderCurrency` USD.

accountingCurrency.description: The is the currency configured for your Organization

amountInAccountingCurrency.description: Transaction amount denominated in accounting currency and in smallest unit (e.g. cents or sats)

externalRef.description: External reference for the transaction. (e.g. Bitcoin txId, Stripe transaction ID...)

customerData.description: Customer data collected on payment links if you enabled customer fields.

metadata.description: Additional optional information about the order

get.description: Get an order by either it's Zaprite ID or your own ID (`externalUniqId`)

orgId.description: Id of the Zaprite organization that created this order

totalAmount.description: Total amount to be paid by the customer in currency smallest unit (e.g. cents or sats)

amountInAccountingCurrency.description: Transaction amount denominated in accounting currency and in smallest unit (e.g. cents or sats)

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Zaprite can send requests to your own server to notify you about events on your Zaprite organization. To receive those requests, add a webhook on your [Organization settings](https://app.zaprite.com/org/default/settings/api).

post.description: Sent to your own server when an Order status changes. You can use this hook to detect paid orders.

orderId.description: You can get order details by fetching the Order

200.description: Return a **200** status to indicate that the data was received successfully. If your server returns an error HTTP code, we will retry sending multiple times then abaddon the message if all attempts failed.

post.description: Sent to your own server when an invoice is sent.

orderId.description: You can get invoice details by fetching the related Order

200.description: Return a **200** status to indicate that the data was received successfully. If your server returns an error HTTP code, we will retry sending multiple times then abaddon the message if all attempts failed.
